channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Do insider or outsider CEOs perform better? Estée Lauder and Ross Stores’ new leaders illuminate the divide
item.description: The insider vs outsider CEO debate continues to rage on.

item.title: What Trump’s Win Means for the Federal Reserve and Jerome Powell
item.description: Donald J. Trump spent his first presidency on a collision course with America’s central bank. Will it intensify?

item.title: 2024 Temperatures Are on Track for a Record High, Researchers Find
item.description: The new report also says that global warming has hit a threshold, at least temporarily, that countries had pledged to avoid.

item.title: Democrats blame Joe Biden for Harris’ loss to Trump—’if he had stepped down in January instead of July, we may be in a very different place’
item.description: The president bowed out on July 21 after getting not-so-subtle nudges from Democratic Party powers.

item.title: Rapidly Moving Brush Fire in California Burns Homes and Prompts Evacuations
item.description: Firefighters were working to contain fires in Ventura and Los Angeles Counties amid dangerous weather conditions.

item.title: Trump’s election win sends private prisons stocks soaring as investors anticipate hard crackdown on migration
item.description: President-elect Trump has vowed to launch the biggest deportation in American history—this could translate to big bucks for companies like CoreCivic a...

item.title: Most of Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’s Accusers Are Unnamed. Can They Stay That Way?
item.description: The argument over anonymity in civil and criminal sex abuse cases weighs the principle of a fair trial with the desire to protect accusers’ privacy.

item.title: Trump’s Win Is Likely to Prolong Gaza Talks Uncertainty
item.description: Any major progress on a cease-fire will probably have to wait until after January’s inauguration, analysts said. Gazans said they were divided about w...

item.title: What to Know About COP29 and How the U.S. Election Affects Climate Talks

item.title: For Rent: 4-Bedroom London House. The Owner? Prime Minister Keir Starmer
item.description: Keir Starmer has rented out his home in north London since moving to Downing Street, according to newly published official records.

item.title: Kamala Harris didn’t offer us closure—and that’s the whole point
item.description: The vice president told her supporters to "keep fighting" following Trump's win.

item.title: What the Collapse of Germany’s Ruling Coalition Means
item.description: After decades of relative stability, the country has entered a new era of political fragmentation and will hold new elections at a precarious time.

item.title: The next time you go under the knife, there’s a good chance a robot will hold the scalpel
item.description: The same kind of AI that powers OpenAI's ChatGPT is enabling more autonomous surgical robots—and that should be good news for patients and surgeons al...
